name: huber
text:
the following post will be understood by people who live - or have lived - in Brisbane, Australia:

Don't you think with that hat on Ray's dad looks like he goes to BBC? (except no one from BBC could ever actually win a fight)

name: k_buttsworthe
text: A comment left by k_buttsworthe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, RiazM, riotdejaneiro, cryztal, pantscomeoff, pwb, StoatLad, grayestnova, _cheesekayke, NDCaesar, deathpiano, lakesofcanada, Jesus, lk, cbchillcb, newwavepony, goslingone, CEOKasen, eRiUukFJk, Rakadin, TheQuietYou)

name: rayonatoilet
text: Did....did you just insult the hat of The Man with the Blood on his Hands? That is NOT a thing, dude. That is not even CLOSE to a thing.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: I hear you.

name: choosebro
text:
Yes, yes this is true for the neck up. Someone from BBC would never jeans and a singlet, that is commoners clothing.

(BTW: Go Brisbane! In any kind of way!)

name: farqussus
text: Brisbane! Choice bro!

name: hawaiian_robot
text: True!

name: gtc
text: True dat.

name: rosie
text: I ride with Rodney. Awesome.

name: thommy_h
text: How is it that Rodney's fake name is more normal-sounding than his real name?

name: epicurus
text: I wonder how much weight Ray is benching there. I mean, he's a cat, so it's probably, what, like 14 pounds or something?

name: whuppins
text: My money was on the Toronto Man Machine.

name: luckyg
text: How does one come up with a name like that anyhow?

name: deusoma
text: Mayhap he was a cyber-organic individual from the capital of Ontario.

name: stuart
text: Perchance he was a modern day John Henry from the home of the CN Tower.

name: invidious
text: Could be he was a member of The Village People.

name: i_love_kate
text: I think he was an early robot, living back in a time when the animal and stuffed animal populace scarcely understood what "automaton" meant. Hence the archaic monniker "Man Machine".

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
There is a factory in North Ontario
With dream comfort memory to spare,
And in my mind I still need a place to go,
All my changes were there.

Blue, blue windows behind the stars,
Yellow moon on the rise,
Big birds flying across the sky,
Throwing shadows on our eyes.
Leave us

Helpless, helpless, helpless

name: mugi
text: OHHH SHIIIIIIIIIT

name: dougthehead
text: I like Rodney's quote- "I just beat the asses of three thousand men.  The hell you leave me alone."

name: hexjumper
text: The way that we know that our world is not awesome is that there are no opportunities to use that phrase in everyday life.

name: wulvaine
text:
Ramses Luther Smuckles is probably the only person who could present a real challenge for Cornelius Bear at the Badass Games. I don't know if there could be a winner.

They'd just stare each other down and make a silent gentleman's agreement to never tell anyone that they were equals in badassery.

name: stereo
text:
Samson performed a beatdown of Biblical proportions, he took out 1000 men with an ass's jawbone and then killed several thousand more by pushing over a building with his bare hands .

If he were alive, he may have been the only other man qualified to use it.

name: firesign
text: Agreed. But... but... wouldn't it be two thousand, nine hundred and ninety nine men? Or did he get himself accidentally in the process?

name: mcnubbins
text: Because he knew he was going to win, Ray's dad made the judges add another contestant so he could beat an even three thousand.

name: dybrar
text: The dude so raw he beat down himself.

name: rasalghul
text: It is possible he is allowed, after cracking skulls and breaking necks, he was allowed to over-exaggerate and round up one contestant.  I know the Smuckles are a proud and precise family, but this is my supposition.

name: turnabout
text: you and everybody else in the world

name: nathanielperson
text: You can tell Rodney is Ray's dad because they wear the same glasses.

name: sargasm
text: And they have the same medallion!

name: pbeez
text: how do you google stuff on e-bay? is that a joke or is it logical but i am too dense too realize it?

name: crinklebat
text: I think the joke is that google is such a normal word now that it can be understood to mean "retrieved" even in an arena in which Google, the company, does not operate. It's like when my mom is looking over my shoulder and sees that the name of a website is Facebook and still asks if I'm looking at my Myspace. To be a successful website is to be mistaken for every other successful website.

name: aaron_haynes
text: This is probably not untrue, but I find it more likely that Ray just doesn't know what the hell he's talking about.

name: layzerblade
text: Ray's only confirmed Internet skill is the ability to buy things. It may be that he can't find any information online except by buying up a whole bunch of primary sources and waiting for them to be shipped to his house: in this case, an old newspaper clipping, a commemorative pin, and a spectators' ticket from the '73 GOF. If you have Ray's kind of money and can afford to ship things Same Day Airwolf, this might actually be a more reliable way of getting information than simply Googling things up on Wikipedia.

name: hoarday4
text: I like to think he actually just thinks that anytime you search for anything anywhere on the internet it's called "googling" and ebay is the only website that ray understands to he just searches for everything there and calls it googling.

name: spoon
text: I think the word for that is "antonomasia", according to the dictionary. Because wikipedia hella sucks.

name: hateandwar
text: Teodor's lookin' pretty slim here.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Thursday Blogs

Pat: Shopping cart incident.
Teodor: TEODOR'S PHOTOSHOP PHRIDAY
Little Nephew: i B moless'ted by mah Thought$$

"I may Lett her explo' tha Science of mah Nature."

name: tekende
text: In which Pat shoves a salami down a shopper's pants.

name: chachibenji
text:
I absolutely wish when I went to the gym that there was a guy there benching, and going "AGH, PFFF, AGHHH, PFF" as he does it.
For some reason this sounds just great to me.

name: unsentletter
text: Ramses fought in '73 out of San Francisco!  Awesome, SF reprasent!

name: direhaggis
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: ctaronno
text: Sweet, that GOF bulletin was written on my birthday. I feel unworthy..

name: kickstart
text: the GOF bulletin was written by my friend's dad.  He also plays the harmonica.

name: jsrand
text: "the man with the blood on his hands" is easily one of the most bad-ass nicknames I've ever heard, fictional or otherwise.

name: poodlelucy
text: he says "check it" like ali g. that's all i need to 5 this.

name: smallberries
text: Mad attention to detail Herr Onstat: the scratched into the photographic emulsion signature of R.L. Stubbs 1973. That's so 1920. Kudos.

name: eviljoe
text: I spend much of my time googling stuff up on eBay.

name: ratched
text: Ray's Dad anticipated the rise of Versace glasses, but not cat thongs. Still, pretty impressive.

name: duperando
text: I personally love this story arc the most. IT. IS. SO. EPIC.

name: duperando
text: I just noticed that Teodor looks suspiciously skinny in this strip. how come?
